page.title: 09Local Churches.
page.content: {St. George's, Wash Common }was built between 1933 and 1965 and is run by 4 priests, who work as a team in 4 parishes. Lay people assist in many tasks like training people for Baptism and Confirmation, youth work and leading prayer and study groups. The congregation comes from the area between Speen and Highclere. There are 4 services on Sunday and special celebrations at particular times, for example Ascension Day, twin town services and Patronal days. 30 Baptisms, 15 weddings and 20 funerals took place last year. {Conclusion.}Of the 4 Churches in the area 2 were Church of England (Wash Common and Newtown), 1 was Methodist, and 1 was Roman Catholic. Most of the local people do not regularly attend any services, though traditionally weddings etc. are still in church.
